body.p: To His Excellency Thomas E Bramlette Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

your Petitioner W. R. Edwards would respectfully represent unto your Excellency that at the Present August Term 1865 of the Laurel circuit court The Grand jury returned into said court an Indictment against him for Illegal voting at the late August Election 1865 to which Indictment He entered his appearance & pleaded guilty and judgment went against him for fifty dollars your Petitioner would further represent that he was entirely ignorant of the law in relation to voting that he had lived in the district in which he voted for several years but was not quite Old Enough to vote but was advised and believed that if the Judges permitted him to vote and did not Challenge his vote and no one else did challenge it That he could vote without violating law That the officers of the Election nor no one else questioned his right to vote and He thought he was not doing wrong nor violating laws by voting and did vote but when he found out that he had voted in violation of
law He came into Court entered his appearance & pleaded guilty & Judgment went as aforesaid your Petitioner is a poor man and not a violater of law
The premises considered the prayer of your Petitioner is that you remit said fine for which he will ever feel greatful and promises to trouble your Excellency no more for the remission of fines
W. R. Edwards Says that the foregoing the Statements in the foregoing Petitioner are true
Sworn to before me by W. R. Edwards this 26th day of August 1865
We believe the Statements in the foregoing Petition are true and join in the prayer thereof

C B Farris
R. Boyd
W. A. Miller
Jos McLean
S. F. Hibbard
James Dees
David Y. Lyttle
Robrt Hays
Wm I Moren
John Brock
Jarvis Jackson
John Pitman
C Pitman
John. C. Blakely
I hope that you will remit the fine against Wm R Edwards for illegal voting

Granville Pearl
W. H Randall M. C
8t Dist Ky

Laurel Cir Ct
vs
Wm R Edwards
$50,
Illegal voting
Remitted 6th Oct /65
